title: DXScanGo正式上线：为“实战挖洞”打造的自动化扫描工具
title_translated: DXScanGo on-line: automated scanning tool for “field digging”
summary: DXScanGo v1.6.8 released, a security tool for scanning and analyzing websites for vulnerabilities, including XSS detection, parameter extraction, and more.

title: H2Miner僵尸网络攻击Linux、Windows及容器设备进行门罗币挖矿
title_translated: H2Miner Zombie Network attacks Linux, Windows and container equipment for Monroe mining
summary: H2miner zombie network attacks Linux, Windows, and containers to mine Monero. The attack uses misconfiguration services or loopholes, including Apache ActiveMQ (CVE-2023-46604) and Log4Shell, to deploy customized loading scripts.

title: 人工智能可能修复帮助传播了 15 年的漏洞
title_translated: The repair of artificial intelligence may have helped spread a 15-year gap.
summary: An unintended static file server vulnerability has been present for 10 years, and AI models have replicated it. The vulnerability allows attackers to navigate outside the specified directory.

title: Wing FTP Server Improper Neutralization of Null Byte or NUL Character Vulnerability
title_translated: Wing FTP Server Improper Neutralization of Null Byte or NUL Character Vulnerability
summary: Wing FTP Server contains an improper neutralization of null byte or NUL character vulnerability that can allow injection of arbitrary Lua code into user session files. This can be used to execute arbitrary system commands with the privileges of the FTP service (root or SYSTEM by default).

title: Citrix NetScaler ADC and Gateway Out-of-Bounds Read Vulnerability
title_translated: Citrix NetScaler ADC and Gateway Out-of-Bounds Read Vulnerability
summary: Citrix NetScaler ADC and Gateway contain an out-of-bounds read vulnerability due to insufficient input validation. This vulnerability can lead to memory overread when the NetScaler is configured as a Gateway (VPN virtual server, ICA Proxy, CVPN, RDP Proxy) OR AAA virtual server.

title: SUSE: CVE-2025-4565: SUSE Linux Security Advisory
title_translated: SUSE: CVE-2025-4565: SUSE Linux Security Advisory
summary: Any project that uses Protobuf Pure-Python backend to parse untrusted Protocol Buffers data can be corrupted by exceeding the Python recursion limit, resulting in a Denial of Service. This can be caused by recursive groups, messages or SGROUP tags.
